00035 #include <assert.h>

00043 int interactive = 0;
00044 #define PRINTF(args...)                                 \
00045     if (interactive) {                                  \
00046         printf(args);                                   \
00047     } else {                                            \
00048         output_ptr += sprintf(output_ptr, args);        \
00049     }
00050 
00051 #define MAX_NAME        (128)
00052 #define MAX_EMPLOYEES   (100)
00053 #define MAX_TITLE       (32)
00054 
00055 char *output_ptr;
00056 char output[2000]; /* buffer for sprintf */
00057 
00061 typedef struct employee_ {
00062     char         name[MAX_NAME];   
00063     uint32_t     height;           
00064     uint32_t     weight;           
00065     double       bonus_factor;     
00066     uint32_t     pc_ip_addr;       
00067     uint8_t      mac_ip_addr[6];   
00068     uint32_t     id;               
00069     struct dob_ {
00070         uint8_t  month;            
00071         uint8_t  day;              
00072         uint16_t year;             
00073     } dob;                         
00074     char         title[MAX_TITLE]; 
00075     uint64_t     passcode;         
00076 } employee_t;
00077 
00078 employee_t roster[MAX_EMPLOYEES];
00079 
00089 static cparser_result_t
00090 test_employee_add (employee_t *roster, const uint32_t id)
00091 {
00092     int n;
00093 
00094     assert(roster && id);
00095 
00096     /* Look for an unused slot */
00097     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00098         if (!roster[n].id) {
00099             /* Found one. Use it */
00100             memset(&roster[n], 0, sizeof(roster[n]));
00101             roster[n].id = id;
00102             return CPARSER_OK;
00103         }
00104     }
00105 
00106     return CPARSER_ERR_OUT_OF_RES;
00107 }
00108 
00118 static cparser_result_t
00119 test_employee_remove (employee_t *roster, const uint32_t id)
00120 {
00121     int n;
00122 
00123     assert(roster && id);
00124     
00125     /* Look for a match of the name */
00126     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00127         if (id == roster[n].id) {
00128             memset(&roster[n], 0, sizeof(*roster));
00129             return CPARSER_OK;
00130         }
00131     }
00132 
00133     return CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST;
00134 }
00135 
00145 static employee_t *
00146 test_employee_search (employee_t *roster, uint32_t id)
00147 {
00148     int n;
00149 
00150     assert(roster && id);
00151     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00152         if (id == roster[n].id) {
00153             return &roster[n];
00154         }
00155     }
00156     return NULL;
00157 }
00158 
00164 static void
00165 test_employee_print (employee_t *emp)
00166 {
00167     PRINTF("%s\n", emp->name);
00168     PRINTF("   ID: 0x%08X\n", emp->id);
00169     PRINTF("   Title: %s\n", emp->title);
00170     PRINTF("   Height: %3d\"   Weight: %3d lbs.\n",
00171            (int)emp->height, (int)emp->weight);
00172 #if 0
00173     PRINTF("   Bonus factor: %fx\n", emp->bonus_factor);
00174     PRINTF("   PC IPv4 addr: %d.%d.%d.%d\n", 
00175            (int)((emp->pc_ip_addr >> 24) & 0xff),
00176            (int)((emp->pc_ip_addr >> 16) & 0xff),
00177            (int)((emp->pc_ip_addr >> 8) & 0xff),
00178            (int)(emp->pc_ip_addr & 0xff));
00179     PRINTF("   Passcode:     %16llX\n", emp->passcode);
00180 #endif
00181 }
00182 
00188 void
00189 test_employee_init (employee_t *roster)
00190 {
00191     int n;
00192 
00193     assert(roster);
00194     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00195         memset(&roster[n], 0, sizeof(*roster));
00196     }
00197 }

00202 cparser_result_t
00203 cparser_cmd_show_employees (cparser_context_t *context)
00204 {
00205     int n, num_shown = 0;
00206 
00207     assert(context);
00208 
00209     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00210         if (!roster[n].id) {
00211             continue;
00212         }
00213         PRINTF("0x%08X %s\n", roster[n].id, roster[n].name);
00214         num_shown++;
00215     }
00216     if (!num_shown) {
00217         PRINTF("No employee in the roster.\n");
00218     }
00219     return CPARSER_OK;
00220 }
00221 
00225 cparser_result_t
00226 cparser_cmd_show_employees_all (cparser_context_t *context)
00227 {
00228     int n, num_shown = 0;
00229 
00230     assert(context);
00231 
00232     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00233         if (!roster[n].id) {
00234             continue;
00235         }
00236         test_employee_print(&roster[n]);
00237         num_shown++;
00238     }
00239     if (!num_shown) {
00240         PRINTF("No employee in the roster.\n");
00241     }
00242     return CPARSER_OK;
00243 }
00244 
00248 cparser_result_t
00249 cparser_cmd_show_employees_by_id_min_max (cparser_context_t *context, 
00250                                           uint32_t *min, uint32_t *max)
00251 {
00252     int n, num_shown = 0;
00253     uint32_t min_val, max_val;
00254 
00255     assert(context); /* don't assert on 'max' because it is optional */
00256 
00257     min_val = (min ? *min : 0x0);
00258     max_val = (max ? *max : 0xffffffff);
00259 
00260     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00261         if (!roster[n].id || (min_val > roster[n].id) || 
00262             (max_val < roster[n].id)) {
00263             continue;
00264         }
00265         PRINTF("%s\n", roster[n].name);
00266         PRINTF("   ID: 0x%08X\n", roster[n].id);
00267         PRINTF("   Height: %3d\"   Weight: %3d lbs.\n",
00268                (int)roster[n].height, (int)roster[n].weight);
00269         num_shown++;
00270     }
00271     if (!num_shown) {
00272         PRINTF("No employee in the roster.\n");
00273     }
00274     return CPARSER_OK;
00275 }

00280 cparser_result_t
00281 cparser_cmd_emp_name_name (cparser_context_t *context, char **name)
00282 {
00283     employee_t *emp;
00284 
00285     assert(context && name && (*name));
00286     emp = (employee_t *)context->cookie[1];
00287     assert(emp);
00288     strncpy(emp->name, *name, MAX_NAME);
00289     return CPARSER_OK;
00290 }

00295 cparser_result_t
00296 cparser_cmd_emp_height_inches (cparser_context_t *context, uint32_t *inches)
00297 {
00298     employee_t *emp;
00299 
00300     assert(context && inches);
00301     emp = (employee_t *)context->cookie[1];
00302     assert(emp);
00303     if (120 <= *inches) {
00304         PRINTF("Too tall!\n");
00305         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00306     }
00307     emp->height = *inches;
00308     return CPARSER_OK;
00309 }

00387 cparser_result_t
00388 cparser_cmd_emp_date_of_birth_month_day_year (cparser_context_t *context, 
00389                                               int32_t *month, int32_t *day, 
00390                                               int32_t *year)
00391 {
00392     employee_t *emp;
00393 
00394     assert(context && month && day && year);
00395     emp = (employee_t *)context->cookie[1];
00396     assert(emp);
00397     if (!(*month) || (12 < (*month))) {
00398         PRINTF("Month must be from 1-12.\n");
00399         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00400     }
00401     /* This is not totally correct but you get the point */
00402     if (!(*day) || (31 < (*day))) {
00403         PRINTF("Day must be from 1-31.\n");
00404     }
00405     emp->dob.month = *month;
00406     emp->dob.day = *day;
00407     emp->dob.year = *year;
00408     return CPARSER_OK;
00409 }

00414 cparser_result_t
00415 cparser_cmd_emp_title_title (cparser_context_t *context, char **title)
00416 {
00417     employee_t *emp;
00418 
00419     assert(context && title);
00420     emp = (employee_t *)context->cookie[1];
00421     assert(emp);
00422     strncpy(emp->title, *title, MAX_TITLE);
00423     emp->title[MAX_TITLE-1] = '\0';
00424     return CPARSER_OK;
00425 }

00451 
00455 cparser_result_t
00456 cparser_cmd_employee_id (cparser_context_t *context, uint32_t *id)
00457 {
00458     employee_t *new_emp;
00459     char prompt[CPARSER_MAX_PROMPT];
00460 
00461     assert(context && id && (*id));
00462 
00463     /* Check that there is no existing employee by that name */
00464     new_emp = test_employee_search(roster, *id);
00465     if (!new_emp) {
00466         /* Add a new record with that name */
00467         if (CPARSER_OK != test_employee_add(roster, *id)) {
00468             PRINTF("Fail to add employee.\n");
00469             return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00470         }
00471         new_emp = test_employee_search(roster, *id);
00472     }
00473 
00474     /* Enter the submode */
00475     assert(new_emp);
00476     snprintf(prompt, CPARSER_MAX_PROMPT, "0x%08X: ", *id);
00477     return cparser_submode_enter(context->parser, new_emp, prompt);
00478 }
00479 
00483 cparser_result_t
00484 cparser_cmd_no_employee_id (cparser_context_t *context, uint32_t *id)
00485 {
00486     employee_t *emp;
00487 
00488     assert(context && id && *id);
00489 
00490     /* Check that the name exists */
00491     emp = test_employee_search(roster, *id);
00492     if (!emp) {
00493         PRINTF("Employee 0x%08X does not exist in the database.\n", *id);
00494         return CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST;
00495     }
00496 
00497     /* Delete it */
00498     return test_employee_remove(roster, *id);
00499 }

00504 cparser_result_t
00505 cparser_cmd_load_roster_filename (cparser_context_t *context, char **filename)

00507     assert(context && filename && (*filename));
00508     return cparser_load_cmd(context->parser, *filename);

00510 
00514 cparser_result_t
00515 cparser_cmd_save_roster_filename (cparser_context_t *context, char **filename)
00516 {
00517     FILE *fp;
00518     int n;
00519 
00520     assert(context && filename);
00521     fp = fopen(*filename, "w");
00522     if (!fp) {
00523         PRINTF("Fail to open %s.\n", *filename);
00524         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00525     }
00526 
00527     for (n = 0; n < MAX_EMPLOYEES; n++) {
00528         if (!roster[n].id) {
00529             continue;
00530         }
00531         fprintf(fp, "employee 0x%08X\n", roster[n].id);
00532         if (strlen(roster[n].name)) {
00533             fprintf(fp, " name %s\n", roster[n].name);
00534         }
00535         fprintf(fp, " height %u\n", roster[n].height);
00536         fprintf(fp, " weight %u\n", roster[n].weight);
00537         if (roster[n].bonus_factor) {
00538             fprintf(fp, " bonus-factor %f\n", roster[n].bonus_factor);
00539         }
00540         if (roster[n].pc_ip_addr) {
00541             fprintf(fp, " pc-ip-address %d.%d.%d.%d\n", 
00542                     (int)((roster[n].pc_ip_addr >> 24) & 0xff),
00543                     (int)((roster[n].pc_ip_addr >> 16) & 0xff),
00544                     (int)((roster[n].pc_ip_addr >> 8) & 0xff),
00545                     (int)((roster[n].pc_ip_addr >> 0) & 0xff));
00546         }
00547         if (roster[n].dob.month && roster[n].dob.day && roster[n].dob.year) {
00548             fprintf(fp, " date-of-birth %d %d %d\n", roster[n].dob.month,
00549                     roster[n].dob.day, roster[n].dob.year);
00550         }
00551         if (strlen(roster[n].title)) {
00552             fprintf(fp, " title %s\n", roster[n].title);
00553         }
00554     }
00555 
00556     fclose(fp);
00557     return CPARSER_OK;
00558 }

00587 cparser_result_t
00588 cparser_cmd_show_employee_id_field (cparser_context_t *context, uint32_t *id, char **field)
00589 {
00590     employee_t *emp;
00591 
00592     assert(context && id && field && (*field));
00593 
00594     /* Find the employee record */
00595     emp = test_employee_search(roster, *id);
00596     if (!emp) {
00597         PRINTF("Employee 0x%0X doees not exist.\n", *id);
00598         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00599     }
00600 
00601     /* Print the corresponding field */
00602     if (!strcmp(*field, "height")) {
00603         PRINTF("Height: %u in.\n", emp->height);
00604     }
00605     if (!strcmp(*field, "weight")) {
00606         PRINTF("Weight: %u lbs.\n", emp->weight);
00607     }
00608     if (!strcmp(*field, "date-of-birth")) {
00609         PRINTF("Date of birth: %2u/%2u/%4u\n", emp->dob.month,
00610                emp->dob.day, emp->dob.year);
00611     }
00612     if (!strcmp(*field, "title")) {
00613         PRINTF("Title: %s\n", emp->title);
00614     }
00615 
00616     return CPARSER_OK;
00617 }

00619 cparser_result_t
00620 cparser_cmd_show_employee_id_bonus_factor (cparser_context_t *context, uint32_t *id)
00621 {
00622     employee_t *emp;
00623 
00624     assert(context && id);
00625 
00626     /* Find the employee record */
00627     emp = test_employee_search(roster, *id);
00628     if (!emp) {
00629         PRINTF("Employee 0x%0X doees not exist.\n", *id);
00630         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00631     }
00632 
00633     PRINTF("Bonus factor: %f\n", emp->bonus_factor);
00634 
00635     return CPARSER_OK;
00636 }
00637 
00638 static cparser_result_t
00639 cparser_cmd_enter_privileged_mode (cparser_t *parser, char *buf, int buf_size)
00640 {
00641     if (strncmp(buf, "HELLO", buf_size)) {
00642         PRINTF("\nPassword incorrect. Should enter 'HELLO'.\n");
00643     } else {
00644         PRINTF("\nEnter privileged mode.\n");
00645         cparser_set_privileged_mode(parser, 1);
00646     }
00647     return CPARSER_OK;
00648 }
00649 
00650 cparser_result_t
00651 cparser_cmd_enable_privileged_mode (cparser_context_t *context)
00652 {
00653     char passwd[100];
00654     int rc;
00655 
00656     assert(context && context->parser);
00657 
00658     if (cparser_is_in_privileged_mode(context->parser)) {
00659         PRINTF("Already in privileged mode.\n");
00660         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00661     }
00662 
00663     /* Request privileged mode password */
00664     rc = cparser_user_input(context->parser, "Enter password (Enter: 'HELLO'): ", 0,
00665                             passwd, sizeof(passwd), cparser_cmd_enter_privileged_mode);
00666     assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00667     return CPARSER_OK;
00668 }
00669 
00670 cparser_result_t
00671 cparser_cmd_disable_privileged_mode (cparser_context_t *context)
00672 {
00673     assert(context && context->parser);
00674     if (!cparser_is_in_privileged_mode(context->parser)) {
00675         PRINTF("Not in privileged mode.\n");
00676         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00677     }
00678 
00679     cparser_set_privileged_mode(context->parser, 0);
00680     return CPARSER_OK;
00681 }
